c74object.name: the.mc.pac~
c74object.digest: Record multi-channel MSP audio in line with a frame-based render process.
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
PAC stands for «Primary Auditory Cortex» and represents an object that allows recording of multi-channel MSP audio prior to rendering video frame-by-frame, managed by the.jit.thalamus. Useful when rendering hiQ video from audio-reactive patches, the result is the corresponding audio to the final video.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. the.jit.thalamus with a unique context name is required running in parallel for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

objarg.name: number-of-channels
objarg.digest: Specify the number of expected channels in the multich-channel signal.
objarg.description: Specify the number of expected channels in the multich-channel signal.

attribute.name: exportname
attribute.digest: Specify a unique name to write to.
attribute.description: Specify a unique name to export to after completion of the recording process, managed by the.jit.thalamus. The resulting filetype is aif

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object
1 = operate normally (default); enable recording and auto-export (see the exportname and export listings)
2 = (idle)
3 = (idle)
4 = (dile)
5 = mute all activity
Note that while recording is disabled, the automatic export upon recording completion (if an exportname is specified) is also disabled and previous files will not be overwritten.

method.name: multichannelsignal
method.description: Multi-channel MSP Audio to record. In line with the prupose of this object, the multichannelsignal would be the absolute output one actually hears along with the video. Check the adoutput~ object for reference.

method.name: bang
method.digest: Open the buffer window of monitoring.
method.description: Opens a window displaying the temporary buffer with all its audio channels.
